\nSocialites celebrate World Water Day i.description: On the occasion of World Water Day which was on March 22, eminent personalities who worked extensively towards water conservation came together to celebrate this day. Water security, water conservation and water cooperation was the theme of this year’s celebration. Madhavrao Chitale, a water management expert, Popatrao Pawar, creator of Hiware Bazaar village, Harshdeep Kambale, city municipal commissioner and Balkrishna Bhakre among others stressed on the importance of water. “There is no source of water in 330 villages in the district. Tanker sources are also reducing day by day. In 2025, available water will be 40 % less than what we will actually require,” said Vikram Kumar, city’s district collector. Ramesh Pandav, a professor at MIT College appealed to the administration to adopt Israel’s water management technique to solve the water problem. A poster competition was also organised on this occasion. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jump rope can help excel in other sports.description: AURANGABAD: A fairly new sport, jump rope, has achieved international acclaim in a little time. Coaches and players say that the game helps one to develop stamina, coordination and concentration which aids in practicing other sports and improves studies. After the recent success of local athletes in the sport at international level, the stakeholders hope that the interest for the game will grow. In the 6th South Asian Jump Rope Championship organised by Bhutan Jump Rope Association from May 27 to 30 in Thimpu Bhutan, Harsheesh Singh Dhingra won two gold medals in under-16 category while Vyankatesh Udawant, Harsh Takwale, Ghanshyam Bhagwatkar, Vedant Wahatule and Vishal Mhaske from the city won two gold medals each in Under-17 category. The students were selected for the international squad considering their performance in the last one year in the state-level jump rope competitions. Certified jump rope coach Abhishek Narwade said that the sport has gained attention from 2006 when the Maharashtra Jump Rope Association came into existence. "Apart from the achievements one can get in the jump rope events, playing the sport helps to build a base for all other outdoor sports. Jump rope helps improve stamina, coordination, breathing control and improves concentration in studies," Narwade said. Harsheesh Dhingra, one of the athletes from Delhi Public School Aurangabad, said that the sport has helped him improve his other interest i.e. swimming. Harsheesh has reached at national-level in swimming. Harsh Takwale, another jump rope athlete, said that he was introduced to jump rope as a professional sport three years ago and since then he has been constantly participating in various state and national championships. "Over the years, my energy levels are high and my academic scores have improved," Takwale said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Latur still away from CAP purview for Cl.description: AURANGABAD: Latur, one of the most sought after cities in Maharashtra for junior college studies after Class X, still does not have the Centralised Admission Process (CAP) in place for Class XI. Each junior college has its own schedule for admissions. Students and parents often struggle while keeping a tab on admission prospects. Santosh Gilda, an education activist associated with a city-based parents’ forum, said Latur must be included in the CAP for Class XI admissions as soon as possible. He also made a serious allegation of corruption within the system. “Besides the obvious inconvenience to parents and students, we suspect there is an active network of touts in Latur. The touts, in collusion with certain heads institutions, help with admissions after charging families Rs 1 to Rs 1.5 lakh,” said Gilda, who is a lawyer by profession. He added that students are forced to purchase admission forms of multiple colleges to stay in the race for admissions. “The CAP for Class XI admissions, if introduced, will protect families from such additional expenditure,” Gilda said. The state education department had introduced the CAP for Aurangabad, Nashik, Amravati and Nagpur from academic year 2017-18. The system is already in place across the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority and Pune (Municipal limits). But despite being a major education hub, Latur, known for its unique pattern for preparing students for national-level entrance examinations such as JEE or NEET, is still beyond the purview of the CAP. The Latur pattern, practiced by a few leading colleges especially for the science stream, involves reduced academic sessions for Class XI to instead focus on rigorous preparations for Class XII. The pattern has drawn criticism from experts, who have objected to skipping of certain parts of the Class XI syllabus. They claim the Latur pattern of learning compromises quality and scope of education to only focus on a good outcome for Class XII examination. Another education activist, Sanideval Jadhav, said the demand for admissions reforms for Class XI admissions has been falling on deaf ears. “We have been urging officials to set up the CAP for junior colleges. The education department should take steps without wasting any more time,” he said. The deputy director of education for Latur division, Sanjay Yadgire, said it was up to the state government to implement the CAP for Latur. “The demand by parents, for the CAP in Latur, has been presented to state-level authorities. The CAP was introduced on a pilot basis for Mumbai and Pune. The system is expected to cover more cities in the days to come,” Yadgire said. A member of the management team from a city-based college said institutions would welcome any student-centric reform. “Allegations leveled by some parents - of financial dealings during seat allotment - do not apply to all institutions. There may be some black sheep. But it is wrong to tarnish the Latur pattern of study as a whole,” the member of the management team said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Will join BJP, get ministerial berth,say.description: AURANGABAD: Former Congress leader Abdul Sattar, who represents the Sillod-Soyegaon assembly constituency, on Wednesday said he would soon join the BJP and get a ministerial berth in the BJP-led Maharashtra government. The latest announcement made by the MLA has confirmed rumours that were making rounds since he resigned from the post of Congress district president about a couple of months ago. The reports of him joining BJP despite being opposed by some party leaders and workers at the local level were making the rounds for the past few days. Speculation was rife that Sattar would contest as an independent candidate in the upcoming assembly elections and join the BJP after emerging victorious. While speaking to TOI, Sattar said, “On June 14, Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil and others will join the BJP and inducted into the ministry in another two days. For now, I am busy with my daughter’s wedding scheduled for June 23. Let me make it clear that I am not only joining the BJP but will also become a minister in the government.” The MLA said he is not keen on bagging any ministry in this cabinet expansion as it will keep him occupied in different parts of the state, which will eventually loosen his grip over his constituency ahead of the assembly elections scheduled for October this year. If Sattar joins the BJP, he will be the first Muslim MLA to do so in the state in recent times. The four-time MLA, who is a known Ashok Chavan loyalist, parted ways with Congress after Subhash Zambad was given ticket to contest the general elections from Aurangabad. In protest, Sattar even filed his nomination as an independent before withdrawing from the contest and announcing his support to BJP state president’s son-in-law, Harshvardhan Jadhav, who contested as an independent in the recently held general elections and bagging around 2.85 lakh votes. A decade ago, Sattar was a minister for a brief period in the Congress-NCP government. Political experts feel that the success of AIMIM-VBA candidate Imtiaz Jaleel in the Lok Sabha elections has boosted the morale of this newly-formed political alliance that is working on to contest the assembly elections with full might, thus making it difficult for Congress-NCP to return to power. “Considering the MIM-VBA presence, Sattar’s move is a win-win situation for the BJP. The saffron party will get a Muslim face and Sattar will remain part of the ruling party,” a political analyst from the region said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Waste management: NGOs, vigilance squads.description: AURANGABAD: The city municipal corporation had hired three private agencies last year to sensitise residents and vigilance squads to ensure that ideal waste disposal practices are followed by them. Close to Rs 2 crore have been spent for the job, but the waste segregation levels haven’t improved and the unrestrained dumping in nullahs continues. Facing outrage for not carrying out timely cleaning of nullahs, city engineer Sakharam Panzade said that their efforts are failing to show impact as people tend to throw waste indiscriminately into the nullahs. “If we clean the nullah in the morning, by evening on the same day you can see it filled with garbage. There has been no restrain by the residents,” Panzade said. Incidentally, around this time last year, AMC had hired private agencies—Knowledge Links, Feedback Foundation and ABTS—to carry out an information, education and communication (IEC) campaign. The NGOs were engaged in zones which were critical in terms of waste management, like zones 1, 2, 3, 7 and 9. The agencies were hired at the cost of Rs 10 lakh each every month. Following the end of five months, the performance of the agencies were not found satisfactory and the standing committee had recommended termination of their contract. However, on the recommendation of municipal commissioner Nipun Vinayak, one of the agencies, i.e. Knowledge Links received an extension. When asked, Shaikh Javeed of Shareef Colony said that no individual from the NGOs ever came to his area. “The waste collection vehicle is not enough for the entire neighbourhood,” Javeed said. The nullahs in areas across the critical zones of the city continue to see rampant dumping of waste. The AMC had also hired Nagrik Mitra Pathaks, comprising of 40 ex-servicemen, that work as vigilance squads. The squads stop people from throwing waste and also penalise them for such actions. The squads also failed to make any impact on the dumping of waste in nullahs. According to Vishal Kharat, who oversees the work of the vigilance squads, the chief contributors of nullah waste were restaurants and eateries. Saving water: Cops adopt villages.description: AURANGABAD: Due to severe drought, the residents of modest Kasrwadi village of Ambad tehsil in neighbouring Jalna district are forced to rely on water tankers for driking and irrigation purposes. However, they are hopeful of getting enough rain this year. Their hopes rose after the Jalna police dug a 1200 metre long trench in the river subsidiary passing from the village. With population of 1700, the village witnessed farmer suicides last year due to drought situation. The fact that the village is situated on a steep surface; it does not have any water catchment area, making it one of the most drought-prone villages in Ambad division. “The village has over 80 wells and all of them have gone dry. We have been allotted three water tankers of 12, 000 litres each, but have to sustain on two tankers, due to heavy rush at the water filter plant from where the drinking water is being sources,” Kawarwadi village sarpanch Viswambar Phulaji Kharat (50) told TOI. The initiative is part of Aurangabad range police’s first of its kind of move to adopt villages and make them water sufficient. As part of the initiative, four police units of Aurangabad rural, Jalna, Beed, and Osmanabad have been tasked to adopt at least one village and undertake initiatives including water harvesting, digging trench in existing water bodies, reviving wells, and other scientifically proven methods. Special Inspector General of Police (IGP, Aurangabad range) Ravinder Kumar Singal told TOI, “This is our small initiative in preparing the villages in beating the water scarcity, which has unfortunately become a frequent phenomenon for the region.” Seeing the policemen doing ‘Shramdan’ in the adopted villages, the residents, NGOs, and industrial houses have come forward to contribute their bit in the noble cause. As part of the plan, a series of initiatives like starting of libraries, providing books, bags and uniforms to the students, reviving the village wells, imparting skill development courses to village youths and also training the farmers in doing farming in scientific manner are on the police’s priority to-do list. IGP Singal, who is currently incharge of the Nanded range which has four districts in the drought hit Marathwada region, is all set to undertake similar initiatives in the region. Aurangabad police initiate action agains.description: AURANGABAD: Aurangabad city police on Wednesday initiated action against at least eight suspects for alleged involvement in trading gutkha which is banned in the state for over five years. The city chowk police team assisted by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) staff raided eight paan kiosks in Naralibagh, Aurangpura, Mondha and Buddhilane area of the city and seized the banned product. “We have arrested eight accused for illegally possessing and selling of banned gutkha from their paan stalls. Apart from the relevant sections, we have also slapped them with section 328 of IPC for causing hurt by means of poisonous substances,” senior inspector DS Singhare said. Based on a complaint lodged by an FDA official, an offence has been registered by the police in this regard. The state has not only banned gutkhas and paan masalas, but also the contents that if put together, form this banned product. Only non-treated tobacco (tobacco with curing) and non-treated areca nuts are permitted for manufacturing, storage, distribution, and sale. Off late, Aurangabad city police have taken stringent measures against illegal gutkha trading0 which is considered to be one of the most lucrative illicit businesses having comparatively lower risk and high returns. In the recent months, the city police have also busted illegal gutkha manufacturing unit that was operation in the limits of Jinsi police station, apart from seizing vehicles transporting gutkha. The Apex court allowing the slapping of section 328 of the IPC against gutkha traders and manufacturers has come as a major deterrent for those in the business as the offence is cognizable and triable by the sessions court. Sources said that after the frequent allegations by MP Imtiaz Jaleel against the thriving of illicit gutkha trading and gambling dens, the city police chief has pledged to wipe out these businesses from the city. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Over 1,200 attend state-level disaster m.description: Aurangabad: Service to the nation is the best service any countryman can offer, said special inspector general of police (Aurangabad range) Ravinder Singhal on Wednesday while addressing the valedictory function of state-level disaster management camp organised at Swami Ramanand Teerth Marathwada University (SRTMU) in Nanded. Singhal also urged the students to protect their unique identity and contribute towards social development. Over 1,200 volunteers of National Service Scheme (NSS) from different colleges participated in the camp that received guidance from teams of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF). Lessons and demonstrations of different life-saving techniques and rescue tactics were given to students during the 10-day camp. “You are NSS volunteers and therefore definitely more motivated than many of your friends. The disaster management camp must have infused new energy in you. The energy must be used effectively during a crisis situation and for social causes,” Singhal said. The senior cop also shared his experiences of being part of teams that organised Kumbh Mela at Nashik and Guru-da-Gaddi ceremony at Nanded. “I learned a lot while overseeing preparations of these mega-events. Putting in place disaster management units was one of the crucial aspects of these events. The NSS volunteers must also prepare themselves for any natural disaster like the one hit Latur district during the earthquake in 1993,” Singhal said. Speaking on the occasion, NSS state liaison officer Atul Salunkhe said the NSS volunteers should utilise the knowledge imparted to them during the state-level camp as and when a crisis situation arises. “Always inculcate discipline in your action and refine your skills by undertaking rigorous practice,” he said. Best NSS volunteers and teams were felicitated at the hands of chief guest during the event that was attended by SRTMU vice-chancellor Udhhav Bhosale and senior authorities from NDRF and state disaster management unit. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. An evening full of classical dances at T.description: With having a special corner for classical dance, the young dancers of Shrimata Nirmaladevi Nrutyazhankar Dance Academy left a special mark in the hearts of Aurangabadkars at the recently held event. Presenting various aspects of classical dance, the dancers put forth a beautiful show as a part of their annual celebration. Held at Tapadia Natya Mandir, dancers Sangeeta Panda and Shraddha Vasekar commenced the program with a beautiful dance which was followed by Guru Shiromani Mira Pauskar's Bharatnatyam recital. At the event was also a Ganeshkruti presentation by the students of the academy which impressed all. Students of second and third year of the Academy presented Aalaripu and Pushpanjali dance. Apart from these beautiful performances, Ganesh Vandana, Shiv Tandav, Swagatam Krishna, Aaigiri Nandini, Aadinaar and other classical dances also impressed the audience at Tapadia. ADG inspection concludes.description: AURANGABAD: The annual inspection of Aurangabad city police concluded on Saturday, with additional director general of police (special operations) Rajender Singh asking city police to mend its ways in handling of the overall affairs. Singh, who has served as Aurangabad commissioner of police, was impressed with the initiatives, including skill development, employment generation carried out under community policing. He appreciated the efforts made to bridge the gap between communities initiated by incumbent city police chief Chiranjeev Prasad. Singh also applauded the city police chief for successfully ensuring peaceful passage of general elections and winning trust of the deprived sections of the society through various confidence building programmes. During the inspection, the senior officer paid visit to some police stations, apart from reviewing the statistics of the total number of offences registered, detected, undetected, preventive measures, number of property as well as body offences, actions taken against active criminals, execution of summons, conviction rate and performance of each of the branches including special branch, crime branch, economic offences wing, and directed for initiating some corrective measures. ADG Singh, on the second day of inspection on Saturday, held a marathon crime review meeting with all the senior officers including the police stations chiefs. In the second half of the day, Singh summoned all the police station chiefs as well inspectors heading all the other branches, in person and reviewed their work. He chided some of the police station chiefs of some prime police stations for failing to deliver on the expected lines. The officer also pulled up the inspector rank officers for poor detection rate in terms of two-wheeler thefts, nabbing of fled accused, and other property offences. ADG Singh also noticed the sudden fall in the recording of offences like mobile and other petty thefts in majority of the police stations. He asked the police station chiefs to personally ensure registration of offences, and pay attention to every happening in their respective jurisdictions, especially in terms of crime against women, children. The officer also reviewed city’s overall scenario in terms communal harmony, vigilance on those fuelling communal tensions, illicit businesses, if any, and as well as the preparations for the assembly elections scheduled for few months from now. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Deputy collector\u2019s assistant lands.description: Aurangabad: The anti-corruption bureau (ACB) sleuths on Monday arrested a personal secretary to a deputy collector in Nanded while accepting a bribe of Rs19,000. The accused — Laxman Baburao Aasole (53) — is an employee of revenue department. The trap against him was laid by the Nanded unit of the ACB led by superintendent of police Sanjay Latkar. The revenue department had seized seven heavy vehicles for carrying sand illegally. These vehicles were slapped with a fine of Rs1,38,500. And the vehicles were supposed to be released only after the payment of fine. But the accused demanded the vehicle owners to pay a sum of Rs3,000 each for releasing all the seven vehicles. Unwilling to bend down to the demand made by the accused, one of the vehicle owners reached out to the ACB and lodged a complaint. During verification of the complaint, the bribe amount was negotiated with the accused who agreed to accept Rs19, 000 for releasing the vehicles. Accordingly a trap was laid and the accused was arrested the moment he accepted the powdered currency notes. A serious cognizance of the incident has been taken by the Nanded district administration, and district collector has pulled up authorities for failing to keep a check on their respective subordinates getting into corrupt practices. Repercussions of the trap were felt in different parts of the region, with sub-divisional officers asking their subordinates to mend their ways or face action. A senior revenue officer informed that following the latest trap, it has been decided that departmental action would be initiated against revenue staffers involved in corrupt practices, especially those involving sand trading. Widespread showers bring down pre-monsoo.description: Aurangabad: Several parts of Marathwada continue to witness a measurable rainfall as occasional spells of light to medium showers lashed the region during the past 36-hours ended on Tuesday. The percentage of average expected rainfall received so far since June 1 has reached to around 28.1% in Marathwada, as per the official figures received. Among different parts of the region that received substantial rains are Patoda (15mm), Ashti (9mm) and Parli (7mm) from Beed district, Ahmedpur (9mm) and Nilanga (6mm) from Latur district, Vaijapur (10mm), Gangapur and Tehsil limits of Aurangabad (both 5mm) from Aurangabad district and Palam (8mm), Gangakhed (7mm) and Sonpeth (4mm) from Parbhani district are among talukas where rainfall activity was reported during past 24-hours ended by Tuesday morning. Good rainfall saw many districts erasing the deficit of quota of pre-Monsoon showers received by rainfall since June 1. As per the official data, Parbhani district has reported highest 45% of expected showers so far during the recent surge, followed by Osmanabad (40%), Latur (31%), Beed (29%), Hingoli (23%), Jalna (16%), Aurangabad (10%) and Nanded (8%). A senior revenue department official said that the delay in monsoon arrival has reflected in lower percentage of average expected rainfall received since June 1. “As per the official forecast, monsoon is expected to reach Marathwada by weekend or early next week. It is expected that showers during next few days may bring down pre-Monsoon deficient even further,” he said. Notably, the state agencies have already cautioned farmers against early sowing for Kharif season of crops even if measurable rainfall activity is noticed for consecutive days. “The farming community is advised to undertake sowing only after onset of Monsoon takes place in the region. We have been using bulk SMS system to update farmers and the same will be used to share favourable sowing period once Monsoon reaches the region,” authorities concerned said. As per the latest forecast by India Meteorological Department (IMD) for Aurangabad, no major rainfall activity is likely in Aurangabad before June 16. In between, the met department has predicted partly cloudy sky with the possibility of development of thunder lightning for the next few days. The city recorded a maximum of 39.2 degree celsius temperature on Tuesday, which was above normal by four units as compared to the normal range. At 22.5 degree celsius, the minimum temperature was below normal by one unit as compared to the normal range. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Women told about traffic rules on Vat Po.description: AURANGABAD: Cashing in on the opportunity of thousands of women visiting Waluj police station for worshipping the banyan tree in its premises on the occasion of Vat Poornima, police ran an awareness campaign on Sunday where they explained to the women how following traffic rules would ensure their husband’s long life. Waluj police station is the only police station in the city with a banyan tree in its premises. Each year, thousands of women from the locality visit the police station on this day to perform rituals at the banyan tree. Organising the awareness campaign on a religious occasion was the brainchild of inspector of Waluj police station Sandeep Gurme. The inspector told TOI, “Several kilometres of the Aurangabad-Pune highway passes through our jurisdiction. We see many accidents which happen due to petty mistakes or for not following traffic norms. Our aim at running the awareness campaign was to make the women realise that merely worshipping the banyan tree for the long life of their husbands would not help, following traffic norms would.” A group of woman constables headed by a woman sub-inspector were deployed for the awareness session. Each women visiting the station was given handbills, with an instruction to paste them at the entrance of their houses. Till evening, around 8,000 handbills were reportedly distributed. Women were briefed on key reasons for accidents like consumption of alcohol, driving beyond the permissible limit, playing loud music while driving, lack of sleep before taking long drives, competing with other vehicles on the road, etc. They were also suggested to press upon the male members of their families than unless necessary, they should avoid travelling at night. Commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad said that the initiative was a part of the police’s awareness campaign on traffic rules. “Apart from professional responsibility, the number of people losing lives is painful at the personal front too. We are running these campaigns with an aim to bring down the number of fatal accidents on the roads.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Bharatanatyam dancers put forth a scinti.description: For every Bharatanatyam dancer, Arangetram is a pinnacle that plays and important role in their dancing career. For Bharatanatyam dancers Aarushi Shinde and Siddhi Tornale of Aurangabad it was the same when they geared up for their Arangetram performance in the city recently.  Amidst eminent personalities and chief guests, the duo performed 11 dance recitals as a part of their Arangetram. The stage performance of around three hours that the girls put up was a sheer outcome of practice and stamina that they have been doing for years. To make the performance worthwhile, live musicians on mridangam, flute, and violin accompanied the dancers. Marathi poems and abhang were also a part of the Arangetram. Under the guidance of guru V Soumyasri, the dancers put forth a mesmerising performance. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nVasantotsav-Nritya Aaradhana-2013, ada.description: The dance department of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University recently hosted a dance concert. Titled Vasantotsav-Nritya Aaradhana-2013, this concert welcomed the spring season and was a treat for dance enthusiasts in the city. A special performance with ‘Save Water’ as its theme beautifully conveyed a message to the audience. There was something for everyone — right from a Bharatnatyam performance titled Pushpanjali to a Rajasthani folk dance as well as a fusion act of lavani and western dance styles. Those spotted at the event included P Medini Hombal, lecturer at Indira Kala Sangit Vishwavidyalaya, Prafulla Mirajgaonkar, Dilip Yardi, and V Soumyasri, assistant professor, department of dance, Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. \nWorld Dance Day celebrated in Aurangab.description: On the occasion of the World Dance Day on April 29, the city witnessed a beautiful dance recital under SAMBHAV: A dance-tribute aiming to ‘Dance beyond physical barriers’ organised at MAHAGAMI, MGM. Under this social outreach activity of MAHAGAMI, a 15-day dance workshop for differently abled children was conducted from April 15 onwards. The initiative was aimed towards exploring and sharing the joy of the expression of dance and its vitality coupled with the fact that creative minds can be nurtured beautifully through dance movements. The performance of these special children from Svayam Siddha was choreographed by Gargi Malkani and Rupal Khedkar. This was followed by a special Odissi dance performance by Nityanand Das from Odisha who dances on only one feet. Nityanand presented traditional Odissi based on the theme Pangu Langhayate Giri. Speaking on the occasion, Parwati Dutta, director MAHAGAMI Gurukul, said, “It is a dance day for us every day as we have inculcated dance in our life and dedicated our life to it. For the past 18 years we have been celebrating World Dance Day with all our heart and excitement.” Spectators were left spell-bound with the performance and gave a standing ovation.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Crime branch nab 2, seizes Gutkha worth.description: AURANGABAD: The crime branch of the city police on Saturday nabbed two accused and raided one of their houses, from where Gutkha worth Rs 7 lakh was seized. The arrested accused have been identified as Syed Riyaz (27) of Khokadpura in Paithan Gate area and Syed Zafar (30) of Misbah Colony in Padegaon area. Crime branch inspector Madhukar Sawant said that the accused have been arrested after the team found out that vehicles carrying Gutkha worth lakhs of rupees was delivering a portion to a suspect in Padegaon area. The team raided their house after zeroing in on the vehicles. Accordingly, sub inspector Tushar Deore raided the house of the suspect on Saturday and nabbed Syed Zafar, seizing Gutkha worth Rs 7 lakh. Three days ago, in a joint operation carried out by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the city police’s crime branch, two vehicles were seized when banned gutkha was being unloaded on Nagpur-Mumbai highway. A total of 243 bags worth Rs 38 lakh, along with the two vehicles, including a pick-up van and a mini truck, were seized. Sources said that with the allegations going around about turning a blind eye to illicit businesses in the city, the authorities have launched an all-out drive against illicit Gutkha trading in the city and have already seized a huge quantity of Gutkha in the multiple raids carried out in the past one month. \nMarathi actress Pooja Sawant performs.description: This fashion event held in the city on Thursday was full of glam and style. Models were seen sashaying down the ramp donning traditional Indian wear. Dancers kept the audience entertained with their rocking performances in between the modelling sessions. Marathi actress Pooja Sawant who had been invited specially for the event, surprised everyone with her lavani performance. We spotted Sanjay Kumar, commissioner of police, having a good time on the occasion. Some prominent Aurangabadkars present were Sanjay Shirsath and Dhananjay Dalal. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Over 50 people fall ill after consuming.description: AURANGABAD: In a suspected case of food poisoning in Beed, several people, including men, women, and children experienced uneasiness in the wee hours of Wednesday after consuming contaminated food on Tuesday night. The affected people were attending a religious event organised in Govindnagar, Dhanora road of Beed city. Around 50 people have been admitted to Beed district hospital. “We are coordinating with the FDA as well as medical authorities so that an appropriate action is initiated in this incident. We are also trying to ascertain if the incident is a result of carelessness or it is case of sabotage,” Beed superintendent of police G Sreedhar told TOI. A detailed report of the incident has been sought from the area police station. Besides, the special branch has been directed to collect more details of the incident. A family residing in the locality had organised a ‘Jagran Gondhal’, a religious event that is typically organised post-marriage. A goat sacrificed for the event was cooked and served as prasad along with bhakri, rice, and a vegetable dish. Almost half an hour after consuming the food at around 11.30 pm, the guests started feeling uneasy. Minutes later, they felt nauseous and suffered from diarrhoea. Sensing trouble, they were rushed to the hospital. Doctors who attended them said that the condition of some patients had worsened due to serious loss of fluid. However, they were on their way to recovery by morning and are currently kept under observation. On learning about the incident, senior officials from the Food & Drug Administration (FDA) rushed to the spot and collected food samples which have been sent for chemical analysis at Aurangabad. When contacted, FDA’s food safety officer Rushikesh Marewar said, “Following the SOP, we have collected the samples of mutton gravy, Bajra bhakris, rice as well as a brinjal dish that were part of the menu at the event.” Sources from FDA said that considering the gravity of the issue, the authorities at the lab have been requested for getting the food samples tested on priority. “Based on the findings, a call about further action against the organisers and hosts of the event would be taken,” a senior FDA officer said. 25-year-old woman dies a week after fall.description: AURANGABAD: A 25-year-old woman, who fell from the balcony of her rented apartment on the third floor around a week ago, succumbed to the injuries in the wee hours of Wednesday. The deceased has been identified as Muskan Kurmi, hailing from Kewarna of Damoh district in Madhya Pradesh. She lived with her husband, Ramavtar, in the apartment at Gangapur Jahagir Ashtvinayak Colony of Shendra area. The couple got married around three months ago following which they moved to Aurangabad-based Shendra MIDC area. Her husband is employed with a private company. Inspector Mahesh Andhale of Chikalthana police station said, “On May 5, the woman was speaking with her mother-in law over the phone while standing in the balcony. During the call she lost balance and fell down.” “We are probing the case from all possible angles, but so far we have not found anything that indicates any possibility of a foul play,” he added. The incident left her with serious injuries, including fractured limbs, internal hemorrhage and head injury. She was rushed to a hospital in an unconscious state. She battled for life for seven consecutive days, but her condition failed to register any improvement. She finally succumbed to injuries on Wednesday at 3am. An autopsy was performed at Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) during the day before handing over the body to her family. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Class IV staff at GMCH call off strike.description: Aurangabad: The class IV employees at Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) went on strike on Tuesday evening to protest against privatisation of workforce by the government. However, the strike was called off in the evening after discussions with the hospital administration. On Tuesday morning, most workers had reported to work at 8am but soon after intervention of the workers’ union, the employees struck work. The strike began to show its impact in the 2pm shift. Meanwhile, talks were held between workers’ association and hospital administration where a delegation led by dean Kanan Yelikar issued a letter of appeal to the workers to end their strike. According to the chief of state-level class IV workers’ union Ravindra Dabhade, the strike was announced as part of the state-wide agitation against privatization of workforce. During the meeting, the hospital administration asked the union leaders to keep in mind that due to lack of staff many surgeries are being postponed which may prove dangerous for patients. Dabhade said that the government should carry out recruitment of class IV staff and fill the vacant posts. Yelikar informed the union leader that the decision on filling of posts vacated due to retirement or death of staff is to be taken at the level of directorate of medical education and research (DMER). “The hospital is pursuing the matter with them,” she said. After the meeting, it was decided that the strike will be called off. At 5.30 pm, the workers at GMCH also ended the strike. Medical superintendent Kailash Zine, while agreeing that the strike did impact the cleanliness services, said that all workers will resume work in the night shift. Hoteliers resolve to share excess food w.description: AURANGABAD: Save Food Committee, Aurangabad, has succeeded in roping in several hoteliers in their endeavour to save food from hotels and restaurants that goes to waste and provide it to the needy. Anant Motale, a retired government official, who is among the Ann Wachwa Samiti (save food committee), said at a meeting, attended by at least 25 hoteliers and government officials, that the participants resolved to share food that they prepare in excess with NGOs working for distribution of food. The committee, which was formed about five years ago, works for save food campaign and has got several function halls, hotels and residents to share the excess food immediately after being prepared with the NGOs that distribute it among the needy. Addressing media persons, Anant Motale of Mission for Hunger Free City, said that recently the committee had a meeting with the help of the Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) and MSSIDC with the as many as 25 restaurant owners, particularly those who serve thalis, to ensure that food is not wasted. While referring to the Global Hunger Index related reports, Motale highlighted that every day, food for 200 crore people was being prepared in the country, out of which food meant for 100 crore people was thrown in the garbage. This eventually leaves at least 27 crore people hungry, he said. He also said that marriage functions are the places where food goes to waste. The government officials concerned have urged hotel owners to follow norms to avoid food wastage, said Motale, adding that hoteliers have agreed to cooperate and have decided to offer 10% discount to the customers per thali if they finish everything served. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nJackky Bhagnani promotes his upcoming.description: Bollywood actor Jackky Bhagnani was in town recently to promote his upcoming film 'Rangrezz'. Talking about his character Jackky said, “I play a middle class Maharashtrian boy from Lalbaug who puts his family and friends before everything else. I hope people like the film and my character.” Talking about the city he added, “I always wanted to come here. The city has good heritage value and people here are very warm.”' Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cycling enthusiasts in the city dedicate.description: To mark the World No-Tobacco Day, cyclists in Aurangabad gathered to take part in the cycling rally. Organised by Signa Hospital and Kalabai Kale Foundation of Aurangabad, various doctors, scientists, businessmen, students and several other enthusiasts showed their interest in the cycling event. Starting from Sigma Hospital to Cancer Hospital, the cycling enthusiast created awareness on the harmful effects of consuming tobacco. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Doctors strike.description: Healthcare in hospitals across the country is set for a major disruption on Monday with   Indian Medical Association   deciding to withdraw non-essential services for a day to express solidarity with their striking colleagues in Bengal. However, in a move that may bring some relief to patients in New Delhi, AIIMS resident doctors have decided not to join the strike. But those in Safdarjung Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, RML Hospital and others will skip work. In Kolkata on Sunday, the agitating doctors said they were ready to meet Mamata Banerjee "anytime and anywhere". The government proposed a 3pm meeting at the state secretariat on Monday. The doctors were reportedly ready to accept the proposal. IMA strike to cripple OPDs todayEarlier, the junior doctors had insisted that the meeting cannot be held behind closed doors and the media should be allowed to telecast it live. The state government, however, cited legalities and constitutional propriety, which prevent such meetings from being held under public glare. The doctors were ready to accept the government's request, sources indicated late Sunday, which would pave the way for "across-the-table" discussions between the protesters and the chief minister. "We are very hopeful for the meeting in Nabanna (state secretariat) on Monday," a senior official, mediating for the state, said. "We have explained to them that given the issues involved, mainly legal, administrative and security-related, it is impossible for the state government to agree to their demand for an open-door meeting in presence of the media. The CM is also sworn to an oath of secrecy in some such matters. We have explained they have every right to speak to media afterwards, much like the norm in all such cases. They have agreed to it," he said. Under pressure from several quarters, including the seniors in the medical fraternity, the junior doctors in Kolkata held a four-hour general body meeting at NRS Hospital. The meeting appeared to split three ways. While a section of doctors agreed to have the meeting at Nabanna, another section stressed on Raj Bhavan as the venue, while the remaining stuck to their demand for NRS Hospital. Pressure further mounted on the striking doctors to find a solution to the standoff. At 3.30pm, a group of doctors announced their stand. "We are hopeful that our CM will be considerate enough to solve the problems that the state is facing in the healthcare sector currently," they said in a statement while refusing to accept any question from the media. "We leave the decision to choose the venue to the honourable CM, but it should accommodate representatives of all medical colleges of West Bengal in sufficient numbers," the statement read. They expressed willingness to join work, "as early as possible in the best interest of the common people once our demands are addressed". In Video:AIIMS doctors call off strike, issue 48-hour ultimatum to Mamata govtDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Police nab one for break-in, recover goo.description: AURANGABAD: A history-sheeter was nabbed by the local crime branch (LCB) of Aurangabad rural police in connection with a house break-in case committed in Vaijapur tehsil on Thursday. In the latest case, the accused — identified as Kishor Wayal (38) — along with his accomplice stole articles worth Rs24 lakh, including 720 gram of gold, 795 gram of silver and some cash. The accused is a self-proclaimed “Robin Hood” and is known for using the stolen money for social activities in his village Mera of Chikhli in Buldhana district. LCB inspector Bhagwat Phunde said, “As per our information, the accused has over 100 cases of house break-in and thefts registered against him in different parts of the country.” Police claimed that they have not only detected the latest case, but have also made cent per cent recovery. A manhunt has been launched for Wayal’s accomplice who is on the run. Wayal along with his accomplice on Thursday broke into the house of a trader, Hrushabh Chajed, who along with his family had gone to Pune. The incident came to light at 5pm, when a neighbour went to Chajed’s house for getting a mixer. She soon informed others and police was called in. During probe, the LCB team found a CCTV footage in which two suspects were found moving on a motorbike. The police soon identified one of the suspects as Wayal, who after committing the offence went straight to his hometown. A police team was sent Wayal’s village to arrest him. During interrogation, the accused not only confessed to the crime but also handed over the stolen articles to police. Wayal recently got released from prison after he was arrested by city police for committing burglary in a similar fashion on February 4. Additional superintendent of police Ganesh Gawde said that the Wayal’s involvement in other property offences committed since he got released is being checked. “We suspect his involvement in more property offences and we are investigating the cases,” he said. MGM hospital to get a modern ICU.description: AURANGABAD: Mahatma Gandhi Mission (MGM) Hospital is all set to get a modern modular intensive care unit (ICU) from Saturday. The charitable hospital already has nine ICUs and the one unveiled on Saturday would be the 10th ICU of the hospital. Pravin Suryawanshi, deputy dean at MGM Medical College and Hospital (MGMMCH) said, “The 11-bed ICU aims at providing state of the art care for patients in Aurangabad so that they don’t have to go to other cities for critical care treatment.” MGMMCH dean Rajendra Bohra said that the ICU infection control system will save expenses of the patient. “The cardiac output monitor at the ICU can help diagnose what is causing the BP to rise or fall which will help in treatment and early recovery,” Bohra said. The MGM’s Medical Centre and Research Institute (MCRI) ICU facilitates also has ventilators and monitor for each of the 11 beds. It also has a signaling system that prevents people from entering into the patient cabin without cleaning their hand with a sanitizer installed outside the room. The other equipment available at the unit includes dialysis machine, sonography machine and X-ray machine. Anand Nikalje, director ICU unit said that the unit ensures a thorough check on hospital acquired infections due to its built-in mechanisms. One can only enter the unit after the operator shows an access card to the sensor. It has a negative pressure room for quarantine patients suffering with diseases like swine flu which prevents their infection from spreading to other patients. The unit also has a positive pressure room for patients with compromised immune systems in which air flows out of the room instead of coming in. It helps prevent any airborne microorganisms to reach the patient. The ICU will be inaugurated on Saturday by MGM Trust secretary Ankushrao Kadam and a workshop for disease management in ICU will be held for doctors in Marathwada on June 15 at the hospital.
