Women artists shine at an exhibition hel.description: It was a delight for art lovers of Aurangabad as they came under one roof when eight female artists displayed their work at the recently held exhibition in the city. Held at Malti Art Gallery, near Kalda corner of Aurangabad, the artists –Manisha Kurekar, Gauri Narsapur, Vjayaya Paturkar, Sharda Uttarwar, Rekha Jakhete, Shalda Mendhekar, Mamta Kulkarni and Megha Padhyay created art of different medium on the canvas. Th exhibition titled –Thousand Shades of Her, saw paintings of various types. Though most of them used acrylic colours as their medium, each painting had a different style to it. Modern art got a touch of traditional Madhubani art and miniature touch, Gujrat's Mad Art and various other types of paintings were at display at the exhibition. Kunal Lahariya and Lata Mule were chief guests for the evening. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bombay HC directs police to file case ag.description: AURANGABAD: The Bombay high court on Tuesday directed police to file a case against Dhananjay Munde, the leader of opposition in the Maharashtra Legislative Council, in connection with alleged illegal purchase of government land in Beed district. A division bench of Justices TV Nalawade and KK Sonawane gave the directions on the petition filed by one Rajabhau Phad. According to the petition, the land at Pus village in Ambajogai tehsil of Beed belongs to the government and was given to the Belkhandi Math in Beed as gift when Ranit Wyanka Giri was its mahant. However, as per law, the land cannot be transferred without the government's permission. But after the death of Giri, his heirs transferred the land in their names and claimed that they are its owners and the government was not informed about it. The land was later bought by Munde on the basis of a general power of attorney in 2012. Munde applied for non-agricultural status (NA) of the land and got it, the petition alleged. Phad had approached the Bardapur police station in Beed seeking a criminal case to be lodged against Munde, his wife and others. However, when the police failed to initiate a probe, Phad approached the high court claiming that the land originally belonged to the government and hence, cannot be sold to anyone. He sought an FIR be lodged under IPC sections 420 (cheating), 467, 468 and 471 (forgery) against Munde, his wife and 15 others. Munde's lawyer Siddheshwar Thombre said there was a dispute between the then Math mahant and priest of the trust on this land. He said the matter was taken to court and on the basis of decree, another person became the owner of the land, adding that in 2012, Munde bought the land from that person by adhering to all legal procedures. It was not mentioned anywhere that the land belonged to the government, Munde's lawyer said while asserting that the entire process was legal. The Aurangabad bench of the high court, however, said prima facie it appears the government land was usurped and hence, directed the Bardapur police to file a case against Munde and others and probe the allegations. Thombre later told reporters that they would move the Supreme Court. Reacting to the court order, Munde asserted that the land for the Jagmitra Sugar Mills was purchased "as per rules and without hoodwinking anyone". He accused Phad of filing the complaint against him out of "political vendetta". Phad is the son-in-law of businessman Ratnakar Gutte, whom Munde had previously accused of securing loan in the name of farmers. Munde also said he would approach the apex court against the high court's order. The NCP leader had last year alleged that Gutte got loans of over Rs 5,400 crore on the basis of fake documents made in the name of farmers. Munde then also alleged that Gutte, the promoter of Gangakhed Sugar and Energy Limited in the state's Parbhani district, had transferred bank loans obtained by various firms into different accounts. "The land meant for the mill was purchased as per rules, without hoodwinking any organisation, individual or the government. The ruling was obtained from the honourable high court through Phad out of political vendetta, as I had raised a matter relating to Gutte," Munde said in a statement. He said documents relating to the mill support his position that there was nothing wrong in the purchase of land and exuded confidence that the Supreme Court will give him relief in the case. "I raise voice on the issues of public concern and that's why such conspiracy is devised against me ahead of each session of the legislature. I will keep raising voice against the government no matter how many personal attacks are directed at me," Munde added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No. of water tankers reaches 3,500-mark.description: Aurangabad: With delay in arrival of monsoon, the number of water tankers pressed into service across Marathwada is nearing the 3,500-mark. The region, comprising eight districts, is currently supplied with a total of 3,423 tankers and the affected population which has become dependent on water tankers has also gone up to over 55 lakh. Aurangabad district is being supplied with the maximum 1,150 tankers, followed by Beed (949), Jalna (685), Osmanabad (233), Nanded (132), and Latur (105). Parbhani (97) and Hingoli (72) districts still have relatively lesser number of tankers. In Aurangabad district, tehsil limit of Aurangabad and Sillod have maximum 194 tankers each pressed into the service, followed by Vaijapur (186), Gangapur (179), Paithan (137), Phulambri (114), Kannad (83), Khuldabad (50) and Soygaon (13). As per official data, Ashti (170), tehsil limits of Beed (147), Georai (128) and Shirur (114) from Beed district, Bhokardan (119), tehsil limits of Jalna (107) and Ambad (105) from Jalna district are among the talukas from the region that have become heavily dependent on tankers. In terms of population dependent on water tankers around 18.84 lakh people are dependent on tanker from Aurangabad district alone followed by 13.61 lakh from Beed and over 12.20 lakh from Jalna. Osmanabad (4.17 lakh), Latur (2.19 lakh), Nanded (1.95 lakh), Parbhani (1.25 lakh) and Hingoli (87,234) are among other districts, where considerable chunk of population is receiving drinking water through tankers. “Amidst depleting water sources, we have acquired around 6,363 public and private wells across the eight districts of Marathwada for refilling tankers. The number of water tankers deployed in the region is bound to increase due to delayed arrival of monsoon. Moreover, we are sensing need of tankers amidst peak rainy season in certain areas,” a senior revenue department official said. “Reiterating that instead of relying on the data of 2011 census, the current expected increased population will be taken into account while pressing tankers into service,” the official said, adding that villages needing tankers must raise their demand with taluka level authorities in order to get an alternative arrangement of water supply in the form of tankers. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Doctors to join national stir, medical s.description: AURANGABAD: Joining the nationwide stir, the doctors associated with Indian Medical Association (IMA), Aurangabad will be holding a protest on Friday. The doctors are protesting attack on junior doctors at NRS Medical College, Kolkata. The stir is supported by junior doctors at the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), Aurangabad. Effectively, only the emergency services at the GMCH will be open on Friday. GMCH dean Kanan Yelikar confirmed that only emergency services will be available on Friday. Incidentally, on June 11, a mob of around 200 people attacked two junior doctors at NRS Medical College following the death of a patient. The condition of one doctor injured in the incident is critical. Doctors in West Bengal are on strike. The IMA has called for an all-India protest on Friday, appealing to doctors and medical students across the country to mark their protest by wearing black badges at work on June 14. All members are requested to send mails to the Prime Minister’s office and union home minister Amit Shah demanding a central act against hospital violence. The IMA has asked the junior doctors’ network and medical students’ network to work in tandem with the local branches and district officials. In a letter submitted to the GMCH dean, the Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors (Mard) representatives informed about their intent to participate in their protest. “All resident doctors will stay away from OPD, IPD, routine OT and academic activities on June 14 from 8 am to 5 pm,” the letter states. PM Kisan scheme to cover farmers irrespe.description: AURANGABAD: The union ministry of agriculture and farmers welfare has issued a communication relaxing the criteria of land holding for those being covered under the ambitious Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM Kisan). In the interim budget 2019-20, the central government had announced the PM Kisan scheme under which Rs6,000 per year will be given in three instalments to 12 crore small and marginal farmers holding cultivable land up to two hectare. The latest decision is set to increase the number of farmers under the scheme, manifold. In an attempt to cover majority of farmers, the ministry has asked all chief secretaries of the states and union territories to extend the purview of the scheme to all landholding farmers in the country irrespective of their size of landholding. The notification, dated June 7, said that the farmers of higher economic status shall not be eligible for benefit under the scheme. Those excluded from the scheme include all institutional land holders, farmer families having one or more people who are former and present holders of constitutional posts, former and present ministers and members of Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha, legislative assembly, council, former and present mayor, and chairperson of district panchayats. The scheme has also excluded all serving as well as retired government employees, apart from superannuated pensioners whose monthly pension is Rs10, 000 or more. In addition to this all those who paid income tax in last assessment year as well as professionals including doctors, engineers, lawyers, chartered accountants, architects registered with professional bodies and carrying out profession by undertaking practices. Acting on the same, the state also issued a communication on Thursday to all the district collectors citing the communication from the ministry of agriculture and farmers welfare. The district collectors have been asked to expedite successful implementation of the scheme. The drought-hit Marathwada region has about 42 lakh hectare of land of which about 38 lakh is cultivable land owned by around 34.82 lakh farmers. As per state agriculture department’s earlier government resolution (GR), in order to ensure filling up of a data comprising name of the beneficiary farmer, details age, sex, caste, mobile number, AADHAR card number and bank account number are being uploaded on the PM-Kisan portal. Crime branch nabs gang of cattle thieves.description: AURANGABAD: The local crime branch of Aurangabad rural police busted a state-level gang of cattle thieves and claimed to have detected several cattle theft cases registered in and around Aurangabad district in the past few months. The accused have been identified as Balu alias Somnath Umaji Mali (31), Dnyaneshwar alias Mauli Shravan Mali (24), Avinash alias Avi Phoolsitaram Jadhav (40), Sopan alias Gotya Ashok Dhangar (30), Arjun Kurde and Ramesh Mali. As per preliminary report, the accused were involved in stealing cattle from Ladgaon, Ranjangaon in Phulmabri, Bokudjalgaon of Paithan of Aurangabad and several other places in Beed, Jalna and others parts of the state. Aurangabad superintendent of police Mokshada Patil said that considering the rise in number of cattle theft complaints reaching police stations, the local crime branch was assigned the job to personally look into the matter and resolve the issue on priority. “During drought situation, the farmers are already under tremendous stress and their cattle being stolen was just adding to their woes,” Patil said. Local crime branch officer Bhagwat Phunde said, “We are confident of cracking many cases of cattle theft committed by this gang.” According to police, the accused used to sell the stolen cattle to butchers in different parts of the state and attempts are being made to identify the suspects who have reportedly bought stolen cattle from this gang. An officer privy to the investigation said that after the busting of this gang, police from different police units have sought details of the accused and are willing to take them in custody for detecting several cattle theft cases registered in their respective jurisdictions. Police also did not rule out the possibility of many farmers failing to register a case of their cattle being stolen. Farmer activist Jayajirao Suryawanshi said, “As a solution to non-reported incidents, the police station chiefs should be asked to check for non-reported incidents of cattle thefts in their respective jurisdictions and register offences accordingly.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra GST department to act on sal.description: AURANGABAD: The state good and service tax office has decided to undertake intensive inspection to keep a check on sale of bogus fertilizers in Aurangabad which causes a loss to the tax department. In a letter dated June 4 sent to the agriculture director and joint commissioner of GST Bhavan, secretary MNS Paithan Taluka Vilas Jagdale and Aurangabad district chief Vijay Chavan had complained to both departments about the sale of bogus seeds and fertilizers directly responsible for farmer suicides. Referring to the action taken by agriculture department in Gangapur Taluka against marketing of bogus fertilizer worth Rs 3.5 lakh, the party unit stated that such practices cause financial losses to the farmers which leads them to the extreme step of ending their life. While the seeds are tax free, a GST of 5% is charged on fertilisers. Jagdale, a homeopathic doctor and a farmer himself, said that the crop loss cannot solely be credited to water scarcity. “For example, cotton is a crop for regions with dry weather. The crop yields better in drier areas than in water sufficient areas. However, it is due to the poor quality of seeds and fertilizer which causes huge losses to cotton farmers,” he said. The MNS activists met with the state GST officials and informed them about the problem. Speaking to TOI, Santosh Shriwastav, deputy commissioner, state GST, confirmed that the department will hold confidential enquiry to find out about the sale of products without the payment of GST. “I have forwarded the matter to joint commissioner, state tax Aurangabad division. Subsequently, our inspectors will verify the books of accounts of the seed and fertilizer dealers and impose penalty if tax evasion is found,” Shriwastav said. The penalty would include tax collection under the jurisdiction of Aurangabad division state GST office which has districts like Aurangabad, Jalna and Beed districts under them. Power outages, bad roads push industries.description: AURANGABAD: Marathwada Association of Small Scale Industries and Agriculture (Massia) has stated that the irregular power supply, poor road infrastructure and irregular water supply may push the small scale industries in Chikalthana MIDC to down their shutters. Constant persuasion of the industry body with the MIDC, MSEDCL and Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) for the amenities has failed to bear results. The closure of MSMEs will not be a good sign for the local economy, industrialists have said. According to Massia, the industries receiving power supply from feeders at Radiant Agro, Industrial 1 & 2 and Greaves have constantly faced power outages for the last 2 years. “These feeders are now known for the frequent power outages. In fact for the last four to five months, the feeders record a power outage of four to five hours daily as the transformers, cables and the infrastructure has become old. The situation turns grim in rainy season. However, the impact of the power interruptions on the production is hurting the businesses,” the industry association states. When pursued, the officials of the power distribution company assure uninterrupted electricity supply, the industry body says. When asked MSEDCL superintendent engineer Nirmal B said that the industries have been informed about a maintenance shut down on Friday. “We will install four AB switches during the shut down which will allow back feeding. If one feeder goes down, we can switch to other feeder and restore the supply immediately,” he said. The overhead cabling is replaced with underground cabling which is causing shut downs but the supply will normalise soon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nChitrakala Mahotsav held at Saraswati.description: The Chitrakala Mahotsav held recently at Saraswati Bhuvan College attracted many art lovers in the city.  The event witnessed a presence of personalities from various fields. Sanjay Kumar, commissioner of police who attended the fest along with wife Roshita said, “Sketching is one of the most expressive forms of art. With so much talent around, educational institutes in the city should ensure that every art aspirant is provided with good facilities.” Around 300 students participated in the Mahotsav. Over 100 works of art that were woven around the theme —India, were exhibited by the students. Dr Ashok Bhalerao, Shital Shahane, Dattatray Bairagi, Samir Kulkarni, Sanjay Pardeshi and Ravindra Toravane were present on the occasion. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sikh beaten in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. In Video:On cam: Sikh driver, his son beaten, dragged and kicked on road by Delhi PoliceDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two minor girls go missing.description: AURANGABAD: City police have launched a search for two minor girls, who went missing from Mukundwadi and MIDC Waluj areas. Offences against unidentified persons for kidnapping the minors have also been registered. In the first case, a 35-year-old woman approached Mukundwadi police urging them to find her daughter. She said that her daughter had left home around 12 noon on June 6 to meet one of her friends. When she didn’t return home for quite some time, her mother inquired with the girl whose home the minor was supposed visit. But she was told that the girl never turned up. Following this, they started looking for the missing girl with other relatives and friends. After failing to get any information about her daughter, the woman finally approached police on June 12 and lodged a complaint. In another case, a 34-year-old man approached the MIDC Waluj police station stating that some unidentified people may have kidnapped his daughter on June 12. He said that the girl had gone missing between 6.30am and 7.30am from their home when other family members were busy in their daily chores. The family looked out for the girl in the neighbourhood and even inquired with their relatives, but got negative response. “We have registered an offence against unidentified people in both the cases for kidnapping the minors (both aged 16) and have launched a manhunt for them,” a police officer said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Machine brought for cleaning nullah brea.description: AURANGABAD: The Aurangabad Municipal Corporation's attempts to use an excavator for pre-monsoon cleaning of Baroodgar Nala have ended up damaging an important section of protection wall along the nullah. The damage, residents said, could now increase the risk of flooding in nearby areas as the monsoon gains in intensity. The AMC was supposed to have completed a major part of the nullah cleaning before the rains, but even until last week, the civic body had not hired machines for the job. Finally, after much wait, residents living near the Baroodgar Nala were relieved to see the excavator - on AMC duty - turn up for the cleaning job. According to Syed Tauseef Ali, a Buddi Lane resident, the nullah has not been cleaned in a long time. “Its water has reached the surface of the bridge running over it due to indiscriminate dumping of waste,” Tauseef said. The wall was damaged a day after the machine went to work. Neha Sadaf, a resident of Kabadipura, said the 30-foot-long, five-foot high section at the curve of the nullah was built to keep the water from flowing out. "Now, we fear 30 minutes of rain will be enough to cause the drain to overflow and flood nearby homes." The AMC had decided to hire machines and engage its own staff for the cleaning of all major nullahs in city - to be carried out under the supervision of ward engineers. The machine was abandoned by AMC staff after the wall was damaged. Sakharam Panzade, city engineer, said the wall was damaged when the machine was being lowered into the nullah. “We will rebuild the protection wall,” Panzade said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

FDA, crime branch seize gutka worth Rs38.description: AURANGABAD: The food and drug administration (FDA) officials along with the crime branch of city police laid a trap at Karudi Shivar on Nagpur-Mumbai highway and seized two vehicles carrying gutka. In all as many as 243 bags of gutka worth Rs38 lakh were seized from the vehicles — a pick-up van and a mini-truck. Based on the complaint lodged by an FDA official, an offence was registered against the three occupants of the vehicles at Daulatabad police station in the wee hours of Friday. The accused have been identified Rubab Ali Hazrat Ali Shaikh (27) and Indresh Shrimadanlal Nishad (28), both hailing from Uttar Pradesh UP, and Tausif Samad Shaikh (20) of Sajapur. Police are yet to ascertain the source of the banned stuff. FDA assistant commissioner MD Shah, who was also part of the team that made the seizure, said the action was a result of intelligence worked upon for several days. Crime branch team led by police sub-inspector Afroz Shaikh along with FDA officials nabbed the accused when the banned substance was being loaded from the mini-truck into the pickup van. Crime branch inspector Madhukar Sawant, citing directives of the commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad, said the action is part of the city police’s all-out drive against all illicit businesses in the limits of the city. Police have also slapped section 328 (causing hurt by means of poisonous substance) of the Indian Penal Code — a cognizable offence triable by sessions court. A couple of days ago, the City Chowk police launched a crackdown against small gutka traders and arrested eight paan stall owners. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Make right to banking a fundamental righ.description: AURANGABAD: The All India Bank Employees’ Association, oldest and largest bank employees’ trade union, on Thursday asked the finance minister to ensure that right to banking should be made a fundamental right. They also sought that the central government should celebrate the 50th anniversary of Bank Nationalisation in a befitting manner by advising all public-sector banks to celebrate the occasion by hailing their achievements in the last 50 years across all sectors. “On July 19, the public sector banks in India would be completing 50 years of service to the nation,” senior AIBEA leader Devidas Tuljapurkar said. Speaking to reporters Tuljapurkar said that the AIBEA, led by C H Venkatachalam, has submitted a representation to the finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman seeking to meet their various demands in the larger interest of the banking sector including nationalization of the private banks. The AIBEA has also made several suggestions for ensuing budget, saying that they expected her to be successful “amidst the turbulent challenges facing our economy at present”. Tuljapurkar said that among other demands the AIBEA has urged the minister to ensure Right to Banking should be made a fundamental right. Other demands include revision of rate of interest on savings bank deposits, interest on fixed deposits shall be exempted from the purview of Income tax and banks should extend agriculture loan at the rate of 2% per annum (simple). Demanding that the banks should extend education loan at concessional rate of interest to the poorer sections of the people, at rate of 5% per annum (simple) with interest subvention, the union urged the minister to ensure that all private sector banks should be brought under the public sector. Tuljapurkar said that they have suggested the government to hold “full control of public sector banks with 100% equity holding and shall not disinvest its shareholding and that the willful default of bank loans should be declared as a criminal offence through suitable amendment to law”. The bankers also pointed out that “non-performing assets of banks have risen phenomenally and the government should institute more debt recovery tribunals and fast track courts to recover bad loans. “The Reserve Bank of India should publish list of defaulters, who owe to the banks more than Rs1 crore. This defaulters list should be published every six months with updates,” the union demanded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Make full use of wells on campus: Bamu V.description: AURANGABAD: Devanand Shinde, in-charge vice chancellor of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University (Bamu), on Saturday asked the university administration to work out on the possibility of making use of several wells situated on the campus for university’s water requirement. Bamu, which is the oldest university in Maharashtra after Mumbai and Pune universities, has around 43 large ancient wells located in different parts of its sprawling 731-acre campus. Most of these wells serve as perennial water resources being located at the level of natural basin of groundwater formed at the bottom of small mountain range on which the campus is situated. Shinde, who is also the vice-chancellor of Shivaji University Kolhapur (SUK), was given the additional charge of Bamu after retirement of BA Chopade. Incidentally, Shinde was working at the chemical technology department of Bamu before being appointed vice-chancellor of SUK. Thus, he is well verse with the functioning of the university and its campus. Addressing the university officials and management council members during his felicitation programmme, Shinde said there is a need for the university to become self-reliant for its water needs. He also asked the administration to ensure that the wells are maintained and make proper arrangements are made for the use of waste water. The in-charge VC also asked the administration to ensure utilization of available water resources to the fullest. Registrar Sadhana Pande, management council members Shankar Ambhore, Phulchand Salampure, Sanjay Salunke, Rahul Maske, finance and accounts officer Rajendra Madke had earlier felicitated the vice-chancellor. “The vice-chancellor also discussed issues like admission process, vacant posts, facilities at university hotels as well as problems being faced by the students,” Sanjay Shinde, a senior university official, said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seminars on consumer rights and financia.description: AURANGABAD: Students studying in colleges under the jurisdiction of the state Directorate of Technical Education (DTE) will soon have an opportunity to attend a guidance seminar on consumer rights and financial literacy. In response to an appeal from the Consumer Guidance Society of India (CGSI), an NGO in the the consumer sector, the DTE has allowed such seminars across all colleges coming under its jurisdiction, including those from Marathwada. In the latest directive, the DTE has asked colleges to facilitate the desired seminars during the academic year 2019-20 by coordinating with the CGSI. “The CGSI is a pioneer non-profit organisation, which was founded in 1966 and works for the protection of interests of consumers. It has conducted many workshops and seminars to educate consumers and will be holding similar events in colleges from Maharashtra during the upcoming academic year,” a senior DTE official said. ‘How to manage money and be a smart investor’ will be the theme of the seminars, which will focus on the concept of consumer activity, consumer compliant redressal and the Consumer Protection Act, among other areas. The guidance seminar is scheduled to have a session each on the financial market, fundamentals of the stock market and essential qualities of a prudent investor. “As told by CGSI authorities, the seminars will cut through jargons and explain concepts and strategies through stories. The workshop will be strictly held on a non-profit basis and no selling of any financial product will take place during these sessions,” DTE authorities said, adding that students will benefit immensely from the workshop as they’d become finance-savvy at a young age. The CGSI will be represented by industry experts during the seminar and their fees will be borne by it only and colleges will have no related liabilities, it was said. Parliament Session.description: NEW DELHI: The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha will commence from Monday during which the passage of the Union Budget and other key legislations such as triple talaq will be on top of the agenda for the government. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, chairing an all-party meeting on the eve of the first session of the new Lok Sabha, invited heads of all parties to a meeting on June 19 to discuss the "one nation, one election" issue and other important matters. Noting that there are many new faces in this Lok Sabha, PM Modi said the first session of the lower house of Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". At the all-party meeting, the Congress raised with the government issues of unemployment, farmers distress, drought, and press freedom, while also calling for early conduct of assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The opposition parties demanded discussion on all such issues in Parliament, with the Congress asserting that it is still a "fight of ideologies". Prime Minister Modi, defence minister Rajnath Singh, leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress lawmakers Adhir Ranjan Choudhary, K Suresh, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and TMC leader Derek O'Brien were present at the meeting. The BJP also held its parliamentary party meet on Sunday with Prime Minister Modi assuring Indians that his government will be at the forefront of facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of "sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas". A day before the first session of the newly-constituted 17th Lok Sabha, a meeting of the NDA was also held here. The government had promulgated as many as 10 ordinances for the session which ends on July 26 and will have 30 sittings. The first two days of the session will be used for administering oath of office to all Lok Sabha MPs. The oath will be administered by protem Speaker Virender Kumar. The Speaker will be elected on June 19 and the next day the President will address a joint sitting of both Houses. The budget will be introduced on July 5. Among the bills that will be introduced, the one on triple talaq could be a contentious one between the government and the opposition. Addressing the media after the all-party meeting, parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi said the Prime Minister urged leaders of all parties to "introspect whether members of Parliament are able to fulfil people's aspirations as their representatives and the manner in which last two years of the 16th Lok Sabha were wasted". An all-party meeting is a customary procedure before the beginning of every session of Parliament to ensure its smooth functioning. Joshi said the government has requested all parties, especially the opposition, for their cooperation for the smooth functioning of both Houses of Parliament. In order to build esprit de corps, PM Modi has invited presidents of all those parties who have an MP either in Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha for a meeting on June 19. The meeting has been called to discuss "one nation, one election" issue, celebrations of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, he said. It will be followed by a dinner meeting with all MPs of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on June 20 to freely interact and exchange views with the government, Joshi said, adding that these two novel initiatives would go a long way in building team spirit among all parliamentarians. Tanker rates hit the roof owing to risin.description: AURANGABAD: Sporadic pre-monsoon showers brought some relief from the sweltering heat but did little to improve the water situation in the city. Low water levels in dams across the region, including Jayakwadi, and power shutdowns for maintenance have aggravated the problem. On Friday, the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Corporation Limited (MSEDCL) conducted a shut down for maintenance works. As a result, taps ran dry in many areas for sixth consecutive day on Saturday. Residents began calling up tankers but were told about higher than usual rates. Suwarta Dongardive, a resident of Cidco N-6, said her laundry is piling up. “We cannot afford tankers but there is no option. We earlier used to pay Rs 300-400 for 2,000 litre tanker. Now, we are being asked to pay Rs 600 to private supplier,” she said. Every alternate house in Gulmohar Colony Cidco N-5 has to shell out money to purchase private tankers. In Nandanwan Colony, if one needs a tanker, they have to book a day in advance. Santosh Bhujbal, a tanker supplier, said his family well has dried up and he has to pay the owner of another well for pumping water. “We have to pay the owner Rs 200-250 and then add the transportation cost. This is the reason the prices have surged,” Bhujbal said. Cidco based SK suppliers said most local well have dried up, forcing them to fetch water from a well near the railway station. In April, the AMC had sought a report from its deputy engineers on the number of public and private wells in their zones with an intent to acquire them following district collector’s permission. When asked about the acquisition of wells, municipal commissioner Nipun Vinayak said a list of acquired wells is shared with the deputy engineers for testing of water and starting the distribution. “It appears that water from many wells is unfit for drinking due to E coli,” he said. Vinayak added that no regulation for the quality or price of private water suppliers is in place but he would prepare bylaws for the regulation and submit it in the forthcoming general body meeting. Jaideep Zalte of the Congress said the tanker lobby in city started growing in the 1990s. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nNational Moot Court Competition at the.description: The recently concluded National Moot Court Competition at the Manikchand Pahade Law College witnessed loads of participation and talent. Law students from colleges across India presented hypothetical cases that raised questions about rights of freedom of speech and expression, corruption and government’s responsibility to maintain law and order in the country. Out of 17 teams who participated in the preliminary round, six teams including the Manikchand Pahade Law College, Aurangabad, qualified for the final round. The final round was evaluated by eminent judges Justice PV Hardas of Bombay High Court and Justice VV Afzalpurkar of Andhra Pradesh High Court. Students of Indian Law Society’s Law College (ILS), Pune emerged winners while Law Center, Delhi University achieved the second position. Ankita Brigit from School Of Law, Christ University, Bangalore won the Late Advocate SA Deshmukh Best Mooter trophy, Priyanka Joshi from ILS Law College, Pune won the First Best Speaker Award and Shreya Paturi from the same college won Second Best Speaker Award. Advising the students Justice Hardas said, “Law students do not spend much time attending courts. They should attend the hearings in court to learn how advocates interact with judges as well to learn courtroom proceedings.” PV Mandlik, Anjali Bajpei-Dube, VD Salunke, SM Godse, NK Kakde, Ravi Ghuge, MV Deshpande, SS Deshmukh, NK Khandare, Dr CM Rao, Dr Aparna Kotapalle, Bhagyashri Godbole and SD Deshpande were some professionals who attended the competition. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

GMCH conducts procedure to detect non-pa.description: AURANGABAD: The Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) here became the first government medical college in state to have conducted an advanced preoperative process called stereotactic hookwire localisation to identify non-palpable cancer. The procedure was carried out as part of a breast imaging course held by the college. A one-day continuing medical education conference was also held as part of the breast imaging course. As many as 180 delegates, including radiologists, pathologists, surgeons and PG radiology and surgery students from Aurangabad, Nanded, Hingoli, Jalgaon and other cities participated in the event. Varsha Rote Kaginalkar, professor and head of department radiology, GMCH, said that many a times cancers are not detected by sonography as they do not have mass. “The stereotactic hookwire localisation process under ultrasound was carried out by two faculties from Mumbai to identify a non-palpable cancer in a patient. The cancer was removed in a surgical procedure subsequently. The GMCH Aurangabad has all the setup required for carrying out the diagnostic process,” Kaginalkar said. In the workshop lectures were held on different subjects and hands-on training in ultrasound guided core needle biopsy on chicken breasts was given. The national faculty for the programme incuded Bijal Jankharia, consultant, Picture This by Jankharia, Mumbai and Sabita Desai, consultant, Breach Candy Hospital, Mumbai. MIM corporators create ruckus during GB.description: AURANGABAD: The general body meeting of the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) on Thursday witnessed uproar and unruly behavior from MIM corporators after their plea to greet newly-elected Member of Parliament from Aurangabad, Imtiyaz Jaleel, was ignored by mayor Nandkumar Ghodele. The MIM corporators raised slogans against the mayor and created ruckus during the meeting. They also tried to snatch away the mace of the mayor. Following this, six MIM corporators were suspended for a day by the mayor. Subsequently, Sena-BJP, Congress and NCP joined hands to condemn the behavior of MIM members and insisted the mayor to pass a resolution to disqualify all the 20 MIM corporators present at the meeting. Following this, the mayor directed the municipal administration to prepare a proposal that will be sent to the state government, seeking its nod to disqualify the unruly corporators. The mayor also asked the civic administration to suspend and inquire the conduct of civic body’s security officer Baburao Jadhav for not handling the situation properly even after being ordered to do so. Ghodele has asked the administration to ensure that 10 ex-servicemen hired by the civic body be posted at every general body meeting to tackle any such eventuality in the future. He also asked the administration to appoint women security guards. It all began with BJP members suggesting that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should be greeted for coming back to power for the second consecutive term. To this, Ghodele announced that he approves the proposal to greet Modi as well as all the newly-elected Members of Parliament. After a while, the MIM members entered the meeting hall and opposition leader Sarita Borde led by 19 other corporators raised the issue of passing a proposal to greet Jaleel. However, mayor ignored this demand saying that he has already approved a proposal greeting all the newly-elected MPs and no specific proposal could be passed. However, the MIM corporators insisted the mayor to consider their resolution. When mayor continued to ignore their demand, the corporators raised slogans against him and tried to snatch away the mace. He then suspended six of the MIM members for a day while asking them to go away. However, other MIM corporators rushed to the rescue of their colleagues and staged a sit-in in front of the podium. In the meantime, Congress corporator Afsar Khan strongly opposed the resolution alleging that MIM MP didn’t deserve such a greeting. The mayor then called the police in. Since arrests cannot be made in the hall, the policemen lifted MIM corporator one by one and took them out of the meeting hall. They also faced difficulty in removing the women members. However, with the help of police women they too were removed from the hall. Water issue raisedAfter the MIM corporators were removed from the meeting hall, the BJP took the administration to task for its failure in tackling the drinking water issue. BJP corporator Nitin Chittee virtually prostrated before the civic officials to draw the administration and mayor’s attentions towards the acute water shortage faced by the residents. Madhuri Advant, another BJP corporator, threatened the administration of launching a ‘jail bharo’ agitation. She said that when she staged demonstration outside the water reservoir, the administration lodged police complaints against the agitators. Advant, who is also a lawyer, said several wards were getting water supply after a gap of nine to 10 days, still the administration or the officials concerned failed to act properly. The mayor then asked the municipal commissioner Nipun Vinayak to explain the situation who said the situation would be under control in a matter of four days. The mayor subsequently announced that a special general body meeting would he held after four days to discuss water scarcity issue specifically. Aurangabad: Medical officer duped of Rs.description: AURANGABAD: A class-II medical officer has been duped of Rs 5.52 lakhs by unknown people on pretext of getting him a medical officer post in London based leading public hospital. The entire cheating took place in a span of 23 days starting from May 15, when the suspects sent an email with a forged offer letter asking the medical officer about his interest in a medical officer job with a minimum salary of Rs 10 lakhs per month. Police officials suspect that the details of the officer and email address may have been lifted from social networking sites. Cidco police inspector Ashok Giri told TOI, “We have registered an offence against the suspects with charges of cheating and criminal breach of trust for allegedly duping the medical officer on the pretext of job in London based leading hospital.” The police are yet to zero down on the unknown people but they suspect involvement of Nigerian nationals in this. Authorities said that considering the fact that a majority of the communications between the suspects and the medical officer took place through email, the help of cyber experts would be taken. The said medical officer in his complaint to the police said that he first received an offer letter from an email address matching with that of London-based leading hospital. The suspects to further win the trust of the medical officer made him calls from an ISD phone number reflecting that of a UK series. After winning trust of the medical officer, the suspects claimed that their representative at UK embassy in Delhi would assist him and asked him to deposit money on pretext of visa and work permit. More money was asked from him on lines of basic travel allowance form, United Nations drug and anti-terrorism certificate, opening salary account in UK based bank, maintaining minimum balance in the ‘newly opened’ salary account, International English Language Fluency Test and so on. The suspect asked the officer to come to Mumbai on May 6 for collecting all the original documents, but at the last moment they rescheduled the date to May 8. This did not go down well with the medical office, who grew suspicious and contacted the UK embassy in Delhi, only to learn that he has been duped by the duo. The medical officer on Tuesday reached out to the police and lodged a complaint. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rampant encroachments within blue and re.description: Aurangabad: A sizable number of encroachments have come up within the blue and red lines of Sukhana and Kham rivers passing within the municipal limits, but the civic body has turned a blind eye towards it. Besides rivers, around 70 small and large nullahs also flow through the city and these natural streams too have been blocked at number of places owing to encroachments. Civic activists have now warned of possible flooding of these rivers and nullahs during the upcoming monsoon season may cause loss of lives. In a notification issued on Wednesday, the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has simply appealed to the owners of unauthorised constructions to remove their structures before the onset of monsoon. “The unauthorised structures built on rivers and nullahs could get flooded during rainy season and may cause damage to lives or property. The owners concerned will be solely responsible for such damage,” civic commissioner Nipun Vinayak said in the notification. The red and blue lines are artificial demarcating of river area on the floodline. The former is decided on maximum water level possibly once in 100 years and the latter is decided on maximum flood discharge in average 25 years. Sharad Advant of advocacy group Marathwada Janta Vikas Parishad said the AMC must take proactive measures to ensure no encroachment exists within the blue and red lines of rivers as well on the natural flow of nullahs. “An appeal made by the civic body is bound to fall on deaf ears. Instead of such half-hearted measures, the civic body should swing into action and remove those structures. Such move will be beneficial for human lives as well as for nature,” he said. Advant added that obstruction in natural flow of rivers and nullahs passing from the city was one of the reasons behind certain localities getting inundated during every monsoon season. When contacted, standing committee chairman Raju Vaidya said efforts were taken in the past to remove encroachments in question but many of those structures came back into existence. “We will ask authorities from the anti-encroachment department to take necessary action. It is alleged that certain elements from the anti-encroachment department are acting hand-in-glove with such encroachers and such staffers were subjected to stern action if found involved in promoting unauthorised structures,” he said. Notably, the official guidelines allow construction on land between the blue line and red line of rivers for public purposes, like roads, while putting the onus for the loss of life or property during floods on the authority giving permission for land use. However, most of the unauthorised structures in question are private ones. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A colourful rally to celebrate Mahesh Na.description: The city on Tuesday saw a colourful rally when Maheshwari community in Aurangabad took out a rally for Mahesh Navami festival. The festival is mainly dedicated to the worship of Lord Mahesha and the Goddess Parvati and the community made the most of the celebration with the colourful rally. The rally commenced at Raja Bazar and was completed at Khadkeshwar. The main attraction of the rally was the dhol-tasha pathak which grabbed the attention of the passer-by’s. Dressed in traditional attires and phetas the people from the community celebrated the day to the fullest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi used the first all-party meeting called after the elections to push for his "One Nation, One Election" idea at a meeting of leaders of political parties to be held on June 19. Making the announcement at the usual meeting of political parties called on the eve of the 17th Lok Sabha convening on Monday, Modi said Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". Wednesday's meeting is to also discuss how Parliament can be made more productive. Modi's invite extends to presidents of all the parties with presence in Parliament. Besides "One Nation, One Election", the meeting would discuss celebration of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi said. Aurangabad: Citizens left high and dry a.description: AURANGABAD: The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Corporation Ltd (MSEDCL) on Friday undertook maintenance shutdown at its feeders supplying power to Cidco, Hudco, Chikalthana and Kranti Chowk areas. The power outage not only left the residents sweating, but also led to disruption in water supply in many areas. MIDC Chikalthana industries also remained shut due to power disruption. According to a release by the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC), due to power outage at Jayakwadi, from 8.30am to 9.40am on Saturday, water could not be lifted at 56MLD and 100MLD pumping stations during that time. Pumping could start at 10.30am from Jayakwadi. This had a domino effect on water pumping station at Pharola, where pumping normalised at 12.30pm. Water works department executive engineer Hemant Kolhe said that it takes around 6 to 8 hours for water to reach the ESRs in the city from Pharola. In addition, as part of its routine pre-monsoon maintenance, the MSEDCL undertook power shutdowns at its feeders supplying power to elevated storage reservoirs (ESRs) at Kranti Chowk, Cidco N-5 and Cidco N-7 from 10.15am to 3.15pm. Subsequently, water supply from these ESRs was affected. Water distribution resumed at 5pm. Tanker supply remained affected throughout Friday in the affected ESRs. Residents from lane number 12 of Jai Bhawani Nagar, who came to Cidco N-5 ESR, said that they had paid for tanker water three months in advance. “The AMC charges Rs1,100 for 200-litre water on alternate days for three months. Today is the fifth day that we have not received any water. Nine of us paid Rs30 each to come to ESR tanker but they flatly refused supply,” Sunita Shinde, a resident, said. Officials at the AMC water works department said that power shutdown at Jayakwadi on Saturday will affect water supply for two days. The supply will normalise only after two days, they said. Meanwhile, production at industries in Chikalthana MIDC had to bear the impact of MSEDCL’s scheduled shutdown. MSEDCL urban superintending engineer B Nirmal said that the maintenance will help reduce frequent power outages faced by the units in the industrial estate. SCR gets non-fare revenue target of Rs 3.description: AURANGABAD: The top-brass of South Central Railway (SCR) has urged advertising and publicity agencies to come up with innovative ways to exploit the untapped potential of Indian Railways in the field of commercial publicity. “The SCR has received a non-fare revenue target of Rs33 crore from the Railway Board for the current financial year (2019-20). In the latest meeting with business partners , SCR general manager Gajanan Mallya apprised the advertising and publicity agencies about the huge space available for commercial publicity in order to increase the non-fare revenue,” chief public relations officer of SCR Ch Rakesh said. As per official data, as many as 734 express and passenger category trains of SCR run with 100% occupancy every day. The zone has around 160 important stations, 24 MMTS stations and 121 MMTS services besides, a wagon fleet of 19,900 wagons, 288 closed circuit rakes consisting of 16,000 wagons and 1,265 locomotives. “Based on representations made by business partners, senior railway officials have been asked to plan and coordinate in creating avenues of publicity and achieving the Rs33 crore non-fare revenue target fixed for the current financial year,” Rakesh said. Earlier, K Siva Prasad, principal chief commercial manager of SCR, elaborated on the new and innovative ideas and concepts being envisaged by Indian Railways in the field of advertising on railway premises such as circulating area, platforms and trains where millions of passengers come across. “The meeting themed on non-fare revenue generation also focussed on provision of facilities like on-demand content for entertainment and education. The business partners were apprised about various changes in the procedures of awarding publicity to facilitate the advertisers,” a SCR official said. Notably, the SCR had registered the highest-ever freight loading of 122.5 million tonne during the 2018-19 financial year — 19% more as compared to the previous year. Earnings from freight transportation have crossed the Rs10, 000 crore-mark for the first time. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani.
