Aurangabad: Machinery for nullah cleanin.description: AURANGABAD: Residents living along the major nullahs in the city bore the brunt of the failure of the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) to appoint an agency to clean up the water outlets ahead of monsoon. The first heavy pre-monsoon showers made their worst fears come true. Syed Mujahid, a resident of Katkat Gate, said clogged nullahs and subsequent flooding is not new for them. “While everyone is excited about rains, our neighborhood wishes that it doesn’t rain too heavily,” he said. On Sunday, the water from the nullah overflowed and entered the houses in his lane. “We didn’t wait for the civic body and cleaned up the entire lane ourselves as it could have caused diseases to spread,” he said. Israel Qureshi, who works at Naan shop near Katkate Gate, said the nullah needs to cleaned and widened to ensure that the water doesn’t overflow. City engineer Sakharam Panzade said the nullah at Katkat Gate will not be clogged now. “We have cleared the waste. The work of widening the nullah will also be taken up soon,” he said. However, on Tuesday, the silt removed from the nullahs was still lying dumped along the drains. Panzade had claimed last week that water would not enter any of houses due to clogging. Syed Aziz, a businessman at Silk Mills Colony, claimed the nullah in his locality had not been cleared for the past one year. “The heavy rainfall over the past couple of days has only brought the waste and silt to the top,” Aziz said. Samina Pathan, who lives in the same neighborhood, said the flow of the nullah had been obstructed and its passage has narrowed. “Water seeped into our walls in the recent rains. We are suffering,” Pathan said. Panzade said they have been prevented from unloading nullah waste at Chikalthana by local farmers and the civic body has not been able to reach a consensus with the protestors so far. He was, however, confident that cleaning of nullahs will take place during the monsoon season. AMC deputy engineer in mechanical section, Devidas Pandit, said the tenders for the machinery to clean the nullahs had not received a response during the first bid. In the second call, submissions have been made for approval of tender based of lowest bidders for all nine zones. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Father\u2019s day: 22-year-old woman don.description: AURANGABAD: Twenty two-year-old Ankita Jadhav, a Nanded resident, donated a portion of her liver to give a new lease of life to her father Sanjay Jadhav, who is suffering from a liver ailment. Both the donor and the recipient are recovering well, doctors said. 52-year-old Sanjay, assistance commissioner in Nanded Waghala Municipal Corporation, was diagnosed with hepatitis-B by a hospital in Nanded in October. On the medical advice of Gopal Rathi, he was referred to Asian Hospital in Hyderabad. According to Rathi, 80% of Sanjay’s liver was damaged. Sanjay was discharged from the Asian Hospital after initial treatment. However, he started suffering from health issues again in January and this time he was admitted to Global Hospital, Hyderabad. Dharmesh Kapur of Global Hospital conducted an investigations that confirmed that his liver had been completely damaged because of hepatitis-B. The disease had also caused forgetfulness and weakness. “We were told we have to get a cadaver liver transplant, but in the organ recipient’s waiting list, my father was fiftieth. The doctors said we can’t wait for that long,” Ankita said. The doctors then considered the option of living donor liver transplantation. Subsequently, the possible donors were explored. “For living organ donation, only brothers, sisters, parents or children are considered. In my family, my uncle and I were found to have a matching blood group with my father. As my uncle is a diabetes patient, only I could donate,” the daughter said. Ankita’s blood group is O positive and her father’s O negative. Ankita, a student of second year MCA, did not think twice and decided to go ahead with the donation. The transplant procedure was carried out on June 10, in which 650 gram of liver tissues from Ankita were grafted to her father’s liver. Fortunately, Sanjay’s body adjusted well to the new tissues and he is currently recovering. Ankita will be discharged from the hospital on Monday and Sanjay will be under care for 21 days, after which he has been advised to take bed rest for one-and-a-half months. 160619 Cabinet Reshuffle: Shiv Sena gets.description: AURANGABAD: The Shiv Sena, which was virtually pushed to the brink in Beed, received a boost on Sunday after its newest entrant, former Nationalist Congress Party strongman Jaidutta Kshirsgar, made his way into the state’s cabinet. It's also the first time in years a Shiv Sena leader out of Beed has secured a cabinet berth. The last time the party had this much influence in the region was when Suresh Navale held a minister of state rank back in 1995. Since then, the Sena has been unable to make any considerable progress in the district - eventually reduced to contesting just one seat (Beed city) out of six assembly constituencies. The Sena would contest from the Georai and Ashti seats too, but withdrew when the late BJP stalwart, Gopinath Munde, won negotiations with the party's leadership, Sena observers in Beed told TOI. Khsirsagar, who had much to the chagrin of NCP leaders supported the BJP's Beed nominee Pritam Munde prior to the Lok Sabha polls, enjoys good ties with the Gopinath Munde camp. He is also rumoured to have joined the Sena at the behest of BJP leadership as the Beed city constituency goes to the Sena’s account for the next assembly election if the Sena-BJP poll arrangement is worked out, party sources said. Insiders also ruled out the possibility of a clash between Kshirsagar and the BJP's Pankaja Munde, the rural development minister and Beed’s guardian minister. According to sources, the Sena would want Kshirsagar to expand the party's base in the district and beyond. Sources close to Khshirsgar said he is expected to lose votes from his Muslim and Dalit base. But he stands to get votes from the Sena-BJP catchment, they said, while citing his victory in the 2014 assembly polls in which he defeated Vinayak Mete, the Maratha leader who had contested on a BJP ticket, by a margin of 5,000 votes. News of Kshirsagar's appointment, however, has not gone down well with veteran Sena party workers. "We now have to work for the man we had fought against,’’ said a senior Sena leader in Beed. He added that the move has "demoralized" senior workers of the party. The Aurangabad district found representation in the form of BJP’s Atul Save, the Aurangabad East MLA, although state assembly speaker, Haribhau Bagade, also belongs to the district. Save’s appointment makes a difference as he is essentially a party worker, state BJP president, Shirish Boralkar, told TOI. "His elevation will strengthen the BJP's presence in the district. It would help the party in the next assembly and the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation elections,’’ Boralkar said. Local sources said Save's appointment would boost the morale of BJP workers in Aurangabad, where the party has been relying on the Shiv Sena, whose four-time MP Chandrakant Khaire lost to the All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen's Imtiyaz Jaleel in the Lok Sabha polls. "Khaire's loss underscores the fact that the Sena has been losing ground here," a source said. "Khaire, instead of introspection, has been blaming the BJP for his defeat. He suspects the BJP supported Harshvardhan Jadhav, an ex-Sena man and son-in-law of the party’s state unit president Raosaheb Danve (also the Union minister of food and civil supplies), to ensure his defeat. But that is not true. Khaire lost because of his bad performance,’’ another BJP leader said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nClassical music concert organised by D.description: This classical music concert organised recently by the music department of Dr Babasaheb Marathwada University was a treat for music connoisseurs in the city. Classical vocalist Pandit Vidyadhar Vyas, sitar maestro Ustad Usman Khan and sarod player Aboli Sulakhe enthralled the audience with their spectacular performances. Research papers were also presented by professors from Pune, Mumbai and Nashik during the event. Beautiful renditions presented by various musicians lifted the mood at this event. Pandit Vyas presented two bandish — Hu To Jan Man Chandiyale and Mori Nayi Lagan Lagi Re from raag Kamod. Ustad Usman Khan evoked a range of emotions by playing raag Charukeshi, while Sulakhe mesmerised the crowd with raag Kirwani. Tabla artiste Vicknesh Ramkrishnan from Malaysia, vocalist Pandit Vishwanath Oak, ghazal singer Dr Dost Mohammad Khan, vocalist Nath Niralkar, and V M Pandharipande, vice chancellor of the university, were among those present at the event. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Schools flouting safety norms to face ac.description: AURANGABAD: With the beginning of the new academic year, city police are working to ensure safety of students in schools across the city. The schools failing to meet all the safety norms, including installation of CCTV cameras, checking credentials of the staffers, drivers and watchmen of the respective schools, will face action from the police department. Additionally, police intend to coordinate with the RTO as well as education department. Aurangabad commissioner of police, Chiranjeev Prasad, told TOI, “We want all schools to have CCTV cameras and that they fulfil student safety norms as per the directives of the courts and government, given from time to time.” Police authorities said schools will be asked to submit the compliance report and those not meeting the same will face the heat. The Aurangabad district has about 4,000 schools where approximately eight lakh students study. Out of these schools, the city has 860 schools, including 70 being operated by Aurangabad Municipal Corporation. This year, some more private schools have come up. They too, will be asked to meet the safety norms. Sources said the police station-wise data about the number of government/civic body-run and private schools is being updated, so that a proper record can be maintained. The education department officials appreciated the move and assured close coordination in the implementation of these norms. Police maintained that soon a meeting comprising of state board, CBSE, ICSE and IB board schools will be held to discuss the same. Schools are expected to surveil premises through CCTV cameras, obtain fresh character certificate of drivers, peons, bus attendants, have female attendants in school as well as in buses, have fire safety gadgets and speed governor as well as CCTV cameras in buses. Bike torched as man objects to drinking.description: Aurangabad: A group of three men has been booked for allegedly setting alight the motorcycle of a man after he objected to their drinking liquor and creating a scene in front of his residence on Sunday night. Abdul Rauf, a resident of Hayat Residency apartments at Ravindranagar, has stated in his police complaint that the suspects gathered in the premises of the residential apartment and started consuming liquor. When the complainant walked up to them and raised an objection, the suspects got angry and threatened him with dire consequences, said the Jinsi police on Tuesday. When Abdul Rauf went inside his house, the suspects torched his two-wheeler with registration number MH-21-AH-7030. The residents somehow managed to douse the flames, said police. The suspects were booked under sections of IPC for allegedly causing mischief by fire and criminal intimidation. The suspects are addicts from the same locality and one of them has been identified, said police, adding that they will be soon arrested. The residents said that criminal elements from different parts of the city join the local addicts in the area, posing a threat to the residents. The locals refused to come on record fearing backlash from criminal elements. When contacted, city police commissioner Chiranjeev Prasad and assured of stringent action against anti-social elements and that citizens should come forward and complain to police. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, State Haj Committee to start Umrah.description: Aurangabad: Maharashtra Haj committee, which on behalf of the state has been traditionally providing pilgrimage services to Muslims visiting holy cities of Mecca and Madina, will soon also be starting Umrah services. The announcement was made during the committee chairman Jamal Siddiqui’s visit to Aurangabad on Sunday. He was touring the city and adjoining areas to review preparations for the pilgrimage scheduled for August this year. “After fulfilling the Haj-related responsibility, we will start affordable Umrah services for the pilgrims from the state,” he said This year India’s Haj quota has been increased by 25,000, taking the total number of pilgrims from India to 2 lakh, out of which 1.4 lakh go through the Haj committee, while the remaining through different private tour operators (PTOs). While in the case of Umrah, all the pilgrims are sent through PTOs. According to those who are in this business, more pilgrims go on Umrah than on Haj each year. Haj is one of the five pillars of Islam, in which the rituals are performed over five days in and around Mecca. Compared to this, Umrah, which is termed as mini pilgrimage, is optional and can be performed any time throughout the year. Usually, Umrah tours range from five to 40 days. During the Haj season, the pilgrims who want to perform only Umrah are not allowed. Haj Committee of India was formed in the 2002 through a central parliamentary Act. In this Act there is a provision formation of subsequent Haj committees in each state for assisting the central committee. The basic responsibilities of the state Haj committees include collecting forms, training pilgrims, providing facilities at embarkation points, coordination with the central Haj committee and so on. The authorities maintained that even if the state decides to start Umrah services, it will have to wait for the amendment in the Act. Incumbent CEO of the state Haj committee Maqsood Khan told TOI, “In the present Act, there is no provision of sending pilgrims to Umrah. Though in the revised policy, which was published 2018, it was intended to start Umrah services, but it did not materialise as there is no provision about it in the Act.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
